ygData.subject: Re: Well, the patch is in...
ygData.msgSnippet: ... brand ... felt ... Dameat bows humbly before Telaren If this is how it came across, I apologize.  That certainly wasn t how it was meant.  If it did,
ygData.messageBody:
>>SNIP>>
>>I just felt that the person who originally posted
>>the question was slapped hard for an honest question. Perhaps he is a
brand
>>new player and hasn't caught on yet. The reason doesn't matter. I only
felt
>>prompted to reply because of the brusqueness of your response to his
>>question.

"Dameat bows humbly before Telaren"

If this is how it came across, I apologize. That certainly wasn't how it
was meant. If it did, that would be from a stressful day at work. It takes
getting home, cleaning, studying, taking care of my son, and jumping onto EQ
before I slip into my happy go lucky dwarven self, when I start being
nothing but friendly. But at the same time, I hope my point is well
received. There is really no need to duplicate efforts made on several
excellent web sites, which I'm willing to bet 95% or so of the people on
this list that are interested enough to care have access to. Simply give
them a pointer, or in cases such as this, why shouldn't it be sufficent to
have the person simply log into EQ to get the information. I get right
around 70 or so emails a day from my various lists (1 /extremely/ high
traffic one (Star Wars RPG), and 1 that I've now gone into digest mode on
not included) that I need to go through...and that's not counting my Real
Life email. So it's quite a task. While I agree, it takes but a second to
go glance at an email and hit delete, multiply this X70, then multiply that
X5 for the week, not to mention the mail that builds up over the weekend
when I don't check it, and...well... it's a hell a chore..

Dameat
10th Level Dwarven Cleric
Rodcet Nife
